byline.contributor: John Harney contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: International groups, even those with staff members on the ground, face logistical hurdles in distributing aid, as the United States, India and China all initiated their own relief efforts.

headline.print_headline: Aid Groups and Countries Face Hurdles in Helping After Earthquake
headline.main: Nepal Earthquake Poses Challenge to International Aid Agencies

snippet: International groups, even those with staff members on the ground, face logistical hurdles in distributing aid, as the United States, India and China all initiated their own relief efforts.
abstract: International aid groups as well as government of United States, India and China immediately initiate relief efforts in response to earthquake in Nepal; humanitarian aid faces myriad logistical challenges due to widespread devastation, which has disrupted transportation network and shut power off in many parts of the country.
